The Scientific Revolution was a period of major scientific discoveries and advancements that took place from the 16th to the 18th century. Some of the major discoveries made during this period include:

1. The heliocentric model of the solar system proposed by Nicolaus Copernicus.

2. The laws of planetary motion developed by Johannes Kepler.

3. The laws of motion and gravity developed by Isaac Newton.

4. The invention of the telescope and the observations made by Galileo Galilei, who discovered the moons of Jupiter and determined the phases of Venus.

5. The development of the scientific method, which emphasized empirical observation and experimentation, by Francis Bacon and others.

6. The discovery of the circulation of blood by William Harvey.

7. The invention of the microscope and the discovery of microorganisms by Antonie van Leeuwenhoek.

These discoveries transformed the way humans understood the natural world and laid the foundation for modern science.
